functions and routines of the code¶

kaLB = kaum ausgereiftes Lattice Boltzmann¶

Corefunction to calculate fluid dynamics

initialize¶

core.initialize()¶

Function :Example:

>>> import template
>>> a = template.MainClass1()
>>> a.function1(1,1,1)

calc_macroscopic¶

core.calc_macroscopic(f, e)¶

Calculate macroscopic density and velocity.

Take a distribution function \(f_i\) and direction-vectors \(\vec{e}_i\) and compute related density \(\rho\) and velocity \(\vec{u}\):

\[\rho(\vec{x}, t) = \sum_{i} f_{i}(\vec{x}, t)\]
\[\vec{u}(\vec{x}, t) = \frac{1}{\rho}\sum_{i} f_{i}\vec{e}_{i}\]
Parameters:
  • f – distribution function: numpy-array with shape = (i, n_x, n_y), with i = 9 = Number of directions.
  • e – directions: numpy-array with shape = (i, 2), with i = 9 = Number of directions.
Returns:

rho: macroscopic density: numpy-array with shape = (n_x, n_y).
Returns:

vel: macroscopic velocity: numpy-array with shape = (2, n_x, n_y).

collision_step¶

core.collision_step(f_in, f_eq, tau)¶

stream_step¶

core.stream_step(f_out, e)¶

Perform streaming-step and return the shifted distribution function.
